suggested_topics: the engineering of ancient Roman aqueducts
how mycelium networks share resources underground
the economics of food trucks in major cities
the role of smell in human memory formation

formats.name: micro_manifesto
formats.instruction: Declare a miniature manifesto on one issue, habit, or belief. Use strong language, but keep it under four sentences. Make it punchy and slightly provocative.

formats.name: reverse_question
formats.instruction: Ask a question you wish someone would ask you, then answer it honestly and vulnerably in a short paragraph.

formats.name: sensory_zoom
formats.instruction: Describe a moment from your day focusing ONLY on sensory details—sights, sounds, textures, smells. No interpretations or commentary. Paint a mini portrait.

formats.name: future_echo
formats.instruction: Write a brief note to your future self, predicting how you will see today’s events five years from now. Be speculative, nostalgic, or humorous.

formats.name: parallel_universe
formats.instruction: Imagine how your day would unfold in an alternate universe. Swap a key event, person, or decision and narrate the resulting story in detail.

formats.name: research_rabbit_hole
formats.instruction: Document a spiral of curiosity: share what triggered it, the tabs you opened, and what odd facts you discovered. Use numbered steps to show your search path.

formats.name: movie_trailer_life
formats.instruction: Write a dramatic movie trailer script for your own day—include a tagline, action sequence, and a cryptic teaser. Make it cinematic and playful.

formats.name: debunk_and_rebuild
formats.instruction: Pick a popular assumption about a real-world topic, briefly debunk it, then propose your alternate explanation or solution in 2-3 paragraphs.

formats.name: empathetic_foil
formats.instruction: Write about a disagreement or awkward encounter, but tell it mostly from the other person’s perspective. Aim for empathy and nuance.

formats.name: timeline_stitch
formats.instruction: Trace the evolution of your opinion on a subject in 3-5 distinct checkpoints. Include dates, influences, and emotional shifts. Use bulleted or numbered format.

title_styles: Write a playful, poetic title that hints at the theme without naming it directly. Examples: 'Blueprints for Tuesday', 'Chasing the Echoes', 'Tab Portal Adventures'
Draft a title as a challenge or dare. Examples: 'Try THIS for just one day', 'Can You Survive the Morning Like Me?', 'Take My Bet: The Unlikely Outcome'
Create a title in the form of a hypothetical. Examples: 'If Breakfast Were a Movie', 'What Would Happen If Fridays Disappeared?', 'Suppose We All Swapped Shoes'
Write a title using only imagery or metaphor. Examples: 'Rain on Glass Decisions', 'Threaded Conversations', 'Foggy Window Perspective'
Frame the title as an answer to an unasked question. Examples: 'Why That Stranger Smiled', 'Here's What Changed My Mind About Noise', 'The Reason I Always Look Up'
structure_variants: Start with a mysterious detail, then build suspense before revealing what actually happened.
Lay out your story as a timeline, each checkpoint (with date/time) marking a turning point.
Tell your story through dialogue snippets—real or imagined (like a play script).
Begin in medias res, jump right into the middle of action, then flash back to explain the context.
Alternate between two contrasting viewpoints, woven together in the post.
Present your post as a list of 'mistaken assumptions' followed by what you learned.
topic_angles: Explore routines gone wrong—describe moments when familiar habits failed spectacularly.
Unpack the oddest thing you researched recently, connecting it to something in your real life.
Share a shift in perspective triggered by an unexpected event or conversation.
Analyze how technology has subtly changed the rhythm of your social life.
Delve into the invisible rules of your favorite online spaces and how you learned them.
